intro: Cyananthus, commonly known as the blue poppy, is a genus of flowering plants in the family Papaveraceae. These plants are native to high-altitude regions of the Himalayas and other parts of Asia. They are characterized by their striking blue or violet flowers, which are often surrounded by colorful bracts. Cyananthus species typically grow in rocky or alpine environments, thriving in cool, moist conditions. The genus includes several species, some of which are cultivated for their ornamental value in gardens.
